National Sentence Text: Lint traps in laundry equipment shall be cleaned after each use of the equipment.
P/T Sentence Text: Lint traps, vents and associated piping in laundry equipment shall be cleaned at intervals frequent enough to prevent the lint from accumulating in quantities that will constitute a fire hazard.

National Sentence Text: Fire department vehicles shall have direct access to at least one face of every building by means of a street, yard or roadway in conformance with the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: Fire department vehicles shall have direct access to at least one face of every building by means of a street, yard or roadway in conformance with the NBC(AE).

National Sentence Text: Where access to a roof is provided for firefighting purposes, keys shall be provided for locked roof access doors and kept in a location determined in cooperation with the fire department.
P/T Sentence Text: A building that incorporates the fire protection equipment, elevator control or door access outlined in Sentence 2.5.1.3. shall provide a key box constructed, keyed, and located in a manner acceptable to the authority having jurisdiction containing a set or sets of keys or devices required to be used in an emergency. (See Note A-2.5.1.3.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Heating, ventilating and air-conditioning appliances and equipment shall be installed in conformance with the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: Heating, ventilating and air-conditioning appliances and equipment shall be installed in conformance with the NBC(AE).

National Sentence Text: Required clearances between chimneys, flue pipes or appliances and combustible construction shall be maintained in conformance with the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: Required clearances between chimneys, flue pipes or appliances and combustible construction shall be maintained in conformance with the NBC(AE).

National Sentence Text: Commercial cooking equipment exhaust and fire protection systems shall be designed and installed in conformance with the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: Commercial cooking equipment exhaust and fire protection systems shall be designed and installed in conformance with the NBC(AE).

National Sentence Text: The installation and alteration of indoor incinerators shall conform to the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: The installation and alteration of indoor incinerators shall conform to the NBC(AE).

National Sentence Text: Signs required by the NBC to indicate the occupant load for a floor area shall be posted in conspicuous locations near the principal entrances to the floor area. (See Note A-2.7.1.4.(2).)
P/T Sentence Text: Signs required by the NBC to indicate the occupant load for a floor area shall be posted in conspicuous locations near the principal entrances to the floor area. (See Note A-2.7.1.4.(2).)

National Sentence Text: Exit lighting, exit signs and emergency lighting shall be provided in buildings in conformance with the NBC. (See Note A-2.7.3.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Exit lighting, exit signs and emergency lighting shall be provided in buildings in conformance with the NBC(AE). (See Note A-2.7.3.1.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Any keys or special devices needed to operate the fire alarm system or provide access to any fire protection systems or equipment shall be readily available to on-duty supervisory staff.
P/T Sentence Text: Any keys or special devices needed to operate the fire alarm system or provide access to any fire protection systems or equipment shall be readily available to on-duty supervisory staffor located in fire department key boxes conforming to Article 2.5.1.3.

National Sentence Text: The fire safety plan for a building within the scope of Subsection 3.2.6. of Division B of the NBC shall be kept at the central alarm and control facility.
P/T Sentence Text: The fire safety plan for a building within the scope of Subsection 3.2.6. of Division B of the NBC shall be kept at the central alarm and control facility.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 2.8.3.2.(2), fire drills as described in Sentence 2.8.3.1. shall be held at intervals not greater than 12 months for the supervisory staff, except that in day-care centres and in Group B major occupancies, such drills shall be held at intervals not greater than one month, in schools attended by children, total evacuation fire drills shall be held at least 3 times in each of the fall and spring school terms, and in buildings within the scope of Subsection 3.2.6. of Division B of the NBC, such drills shall be held at intervals not greater than 2 months.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 2.8.3.2.(2), fire drills as described in Sentence 2.8.3.1. shall be held at intervals not greater than 12 months for the supervisory staff, except that in day-care centres and in Group B major occupancies, such drills shall be held at intervals not greater than one month, in schools attended by children, total evacuation fire drills shall be held at least 3 times in each of the fall and spring school terms, and in buildings within the scope of Subsection 3.2.6. of Division B of the NBC(AE), such drills shall be held at intervals not greater than 2 months.

National Sentence Text: Tents and air-supported structures shall be designed and installed in conformance with the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: Tents and air-supported structures shall be designed and installed in conformance with the NBC(AE).

National Sentence Text: Daycare centres shall be constructed in conformance with the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: Daycare centres shall be constructed in conformance with the NBC(AE).

National Sentence Text: There shall be at least one staff member for each 10 children 2 years of age and older and, where children under the age of 2 years are cared for, there shall be at least one additional staff member for every 5 such children.
P/T Sentence Text: The operators of day-care centres shall provide a staffing ratio for the supervision of children as required by the Child Care Licensing Act and its Regulations.

National Sentence Text: Areas or rooms communicating with the landing area shall be separated therefrom by a fire separation conforming to the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: Areas or rooms communicating with the landing area shall be separated therefrom by a fire separation conforming to the NBC(AE).

National Sentence Text: Where wiring or electrical equipment is located in areas in which flammable gases or vapours, combustible dusts or combustible fibres are present in quantities sufficient to create a hazard, such wiring and electrical equipment shall conform to Sentence 3.3.6.2. of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: Where wiring or electrical equipment is located in areas in which flammable gases or vapours, combustible dusts or combustible fibres are present in quantities sufficient to create a hazard, such wiring and electrical equipment shall conform to Sentence 3.3.6.2. of Division B of the NBC(AE).

National Sentence Text: A tire storage area designed to contain more than 375 m3 of rubber tires shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation conforming to Article 3.3.6.5. of Division B of the NBC. (See Note A-3.2.4.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: A tire storage area designed to contain more than 375 m3 of rubber tires shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation conforming to Article 3.3.6.5. of Division B of the NBC(AE). (See Note A-3.2.4.2.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Buildings or parts thereof used for the storage of baled combustible fibres shall conform to Article 3.1.2.6. of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: Buildings or parts thereof used for the storage of baled combustible fibres shall conform to Article 3.1.2.6. of Division B of the NBC(AE).

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Table 3.2.7.6., solid and liquid dangerous goods classified as oxidizers or organic peroxides shall be separated from the remainder of the building in conformance with Sentence 3.3.6.2. of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Table 3.2.7.6., solid and liquid dangerous goods classified as oxidizers or organic peroxides shall be separated from the remainder of the building in conformance with Sentence 3.3.6.2. of Division B of the NBC(AE).

National Sentence Text: Reactive materials shall be separated from the remainder of the building in conformance with Sentence 3.3.6.2. of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: Reactive materials shall be separated from the remainder of the building in conformance with Sentence 3.3.6.2. of Division B of the NBC(AE).

National Sentence Text: Floors in areas where dangerous goods are stored shall be constructed in conformance with Sentence 3.3.6.7. of Division B of the NBC, and maintained as an impervious membrane.
P/T Sentence Text: Floors in areas where dangerous goods are stored shall be constructed in conformance with Sentence 3.3.6.7. of Division B of the NBC(AE), and maintained as an impervious membrane.

National Article Title: Indoor Storage of Anhydrous Ammonia and Toxic
National Sentence Text: Cylinders of anhydrous ammonia or dangerous goods classified as toxic or oxidizing gases stored indoors shall be located in a room that is separated from the remainder of the building in conformance with Sentence 3.3.6.3. of Division B of the NBC, is located on an exterior wall, can be entered from the exterior, and whose closures leading to the interior of the building are in conformance with Sentence 3.3.6.3. of Division B of the NBC, and is provided with ventilation to the outdoors.
P/T Article Title: Indoor Storage of Anhydrous Ammonia and Toxic
P/T Sentence Text: Cylinders of anhydrous ammonia or dangerous goods classified as toxic or oxidizing gases stored indoors shall be located in a room that is separated from the remainder of the building in conformance with Sentence 3.3.6.3. of Division B of the NBC(AE), is located on an exterior wall, can be entered from the exterior, and whose closures leading to the interior of the building are in conformance with Sentence 3.3.6.3. of Division B of the NBC(AE), and is provided with ventilation to the outdoors.

National Sentence Text: The occupancy classification of buildings intended for the storage of ammonium nitrate shall conform to Sentence 3.3.6.6. of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: The occupancy classification of buildings intended for the storage of ammonium nitrate shall conform to Sentence 3.3.6.6. of Division B of the NBC(AE).

National Sentence Text: The height of buildings intended for the storage of ammonium nitrate shall conform to Sentence 3.3.6.6. of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: The height of buildings intended for the storage of ammonium nitrate shall conform to Sentence 3.3.6.6. of Division B of the NBC(AE).

National Sentence Text: All flooring in storage areas shall be constructed of noncombustible materials, as stated in Sentence 3.3.6.6. of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: All flooring in storage areas shall be constructed of noncombustible materials, as stated in Sentence 3.3.6.6. of Division B of the NBC(AE).

National Sentence Text: Buildings used for the storage of ammonium nitrate shall incorporate spatial separation and exposure protection in conformance with Subsection 3.2.3. of Division B of the NBC. (See Note A-3.2.9.2.(5).)
P/T Sentence Text: Buildings used for the storage of ammonium nitrate shall incorporate spatial separation and exposure protection in conformance with Subsection 3.2.3. of Division B of the NBC(AE). (See Note A-3.2.9.2.(5).)

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.2.5.(2), an access route constructed in conformance with Subsection 3.2.5. of Division B of the NBC shall be provided to permit the approach of fire department vehicles to within 60 m travelling distance of any part of an individual storage area.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 3.3.2.5.(2), an access route constructed in conformance with Subsection 3.2.5. of Division B of the NBC shall be provided to permit the approach of fire department vehicles to within 60 m travelling distance of any part of an individual storage area.

National Sentence Text: Where refrigerators are used to store Class I liquids, they shall be designed so that electrical equipment located within the storage compartment, within the outer shell, on the door and on the door frame of the refrigerator is in conformance with CSA C22.1-12 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I for Class I, Zone 0 or 1 hazardous locations based on the frequency of occurrence and duration of an explosive gaseous atmosphere, and electrical equipment mounted on the outside surface of the refrigerator is in conformance with CSA C22.1-12 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I for Class I, Zone 2 hazardous locations, or located above the top of the storage compartment.
P/T Sentence Text: Where refrigerators are used to store Class I liquids, they shall be designed so that electrical equipment located within the storage compartment, within the outer shell, on the door and on the door frame of the refrigerator is in conformance with CSA C22.1-18 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I for Class I, Zone 0 or 1 hazardous locations based on the frequency of occurrence and duration of an explosive gaseous atmosphere, and electrical equipment mounted on the outside surface of the refrigerator is in conformance with CSA C22.1-18 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I for Class I, Zone 2 hazardous locations, or located above the top of the storage compartment.

National Sentence Text: Where flammable liquids and combustible liquids are processed, handled, stored, dispensed or used within rooms or enclosed spaces, ventilation shall conform to the appropriate provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws, or in the absence of such legislation, to this Part and the NBC. (See Note A-4.1.7.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where flammable liquids and combustible liquids are processed, handled, stored, dispensed or used within rooms or enclosed spaces, ventilation shall conform to the appropriate provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws, or in the absence of such legislation, to this Part and the NBC(AE). (See Note A-4.1.7.1.(1).)

National Sentence Text: It is permitted to use movable tanks for dispensing flammable liquids or combustible liquids into the fuel tanks of vehicles or other motorized equipment provided such movable tanks are used in conformance with the requirements of this Part for storage tanks.
P/T Sentence Text: It is permitted to use movable tanks for dispensing flammable liquids or combustible liquids into the fuel tanks of vehicles or other motorized equipment provided such movable tanks are used in conformance with the requirements of this Part for storage tanks. (See Note A-4.1.8.4.(1).)

National Sentence Text: The location of storage rooms referred to in Sentence 4.2.4.2. shall conform to Article 3.3.2.16. and Sentence 3.3.4.3. of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: The location of storage rooms referred to in Sentence 4.2.4.2. shall conform to Article 3.3.2.16. and Sentence 3.3.4.3. of Division B of the NBC(AE).

National Sentence Text: Except for the storage of distilled beverage alcohol, where Class IA or IB liquids are used, dispensed or stored in open containers within a storage room, or where Class IA liquids are stored in containers exceeding 4 L in capacity, the room shall be designed to prevent critical structural and mechanical damage from an internal explosion in conformance with Sentence 3.3.6.4. of Division B of the NBC. (See Note A-3.2.8.2.(1)(d).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except for the storage of distilled beverage alcohol, where Class IA or IB liquids are used, dispensed or stored in open containers within a storage room, or where Class IA liquids are stored in containers exceeding 4 L in capacity, the room shall be designed to prevent critical structural and mechanical damage from an internal explosion in conformance with Sentence 3.3.6.4. of Division B of the NBC(AE). (See Note A-3.2.8.2.(1)(d).)

National Sentence Text: An access route not less than 6 m wide constructed in conformance with Subsection 3.2.5. of Division B of the NBC shall be provided in outdoor storage areas to permit the approach of fire department vehicles to within 60 m of any part of a pile.
P/T Sentence Text: An access route not less than 6 m wide constructed in conformance with Subsection 3.2.5. of Division B of the NBC shall be provided in outdoor storage areas to permit the approach of fire department vehicles to within 60 m of any part of a pile.

National Sentence Text: The minimum distance required in Sentence 4.3.2.1. from a storage tank containing only Class II or IIIA liquids to a building on the same property is permitted to be reduced to 1.5 m provided the tank capacity is not more than 50 000 L, or zero provided the tank capacity is not more than 2 500 L.
P/T Sentence Text: The minimum distance required in Sentence 4.3.2.1. from a storage tank containing only Class II or IIIA liquids to a building on the same property is permitted to be reduced to 1.5 m provided the tank capacity is not more than 80 000 L, or zero provided the tank capacity is not more than 2 500 L.

National Sentence Text: An access route constructed in conformance with Subsection 3.2.5. of Division B of the NBC shall be provided in outdoor storage areas to permit the approach of fire department vehicles to within 60 m travelling distance of any storage tank.
P/T Sentence Text: An access route constructed in conformance with Subsection 3.2.5. of Division B of the NBC shall be provided in outdoor storage areas to permit the approach of fire department vehicles to within 60 m travelling distance of any storage tank.

National Sentence Text: In areas subject to earthquake forces, storage tanks, supports and connections shall be designed to resist such forces in conformance with Part 4 of Division B of the NBC, and Appendix A2 of ULC CAN/ULC-S601-14 Shop Fabricated Steel Aboveground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: In areas subject to earthquake forces, storage tanks, supports and connections shall be designed to resist such forces in conformance with Part 4 of Division B of the NBC(AE), and Appendix A2 of ULC CAN/ULC-S601-14 Shop Fabricated Steel Aboveground Tanks for Flammable and Combustible Liquids

National Sentence Text: Damage to storage tank shells shall not be repaired on site.
P/T Sentence Text: An underground storage tank that is damaged shall not be repaired on site and used for storage unless the repair is done by the manufacturer in accordance with ULC refurbishing specifications, and the manufacturer certifies in writing that the repaired tank meets the applicable manufacturing codes.

National Sentence Text: Installations using Class I liquids as fuel supplies for stationary engines inside buildings shall conform to NFPA 37-2015 Installation and Use of Stationary Combustion Engines and Gas Turbines
P/T Sentence Text: Storage tank systems using Class I liquids as fuel supplies for stationary engines inside buildings shall conform to this Part when they are used to supply appliances installed in conformance with NFPA 37-2015 Installation and Use of Stationary Combustion Engines and Gas Turbines

National Sentence Text: In buildings not required to be equipped with a standpipe and hose system by the NBC, hose stations shall be provided in the vicinity of the storage room, such that all parts of the room are within reach of a hose stream. (See Note A-4.3.14.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: In buildings not required to be equipped with a standpipe and hose system by the NBC(AE), hose stations shall be provided in the vicinity of the storage room, such that all parts of the room are within reach of a hose stream. (See Note A-4.3.14.4.(1).)

National Sentence Text: The removal, abandonment in place, disposal or temporary taking out of service of an underground storage tank shall be in conformance with good engineering practice. (See Note A-4.3.16.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: When underground storage tanks will be out of service for a period not exceeding 180 days, the liquid level in the storage tank shall be measured at intervals not greater than one month and a record of the measurements shall be retained in conformance with Article 2.2.1.2., fill pipe covers and covers over openings to measure liquid levels, dispensers and power controls shall be kept locked when not in use, and vent piping shall be kept open.

National Sentence Text: Where a storage tank is to be permanently disposed of, sufficient openings shall be cut in the tank to render it unfit for further use.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a storage tank is to be permanently disposed of, sufficient openings shall be cut in the tank to render it unfit for further use. (See Note A-4.3.16.3.(1).)

National Sentence Text: The removal, abandonment in place, disposal or temporary taking out of service of an underground piping system shall be in conformance with good engineering practice. (See Note A-4.3.16.1.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Corrosion protection systems shall be maintained in operating condition when a storage tank is temporarily out of service and during seasonal shutdowns.

National Sentence Text: Except for vent risers and vertical fill piping systems, underground piping systems shall be of double-walled construction.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for vent risers and vertical fill piping systems, underground piping systems shall be of double-walled construction. (See Note A-4.5.6.1.(1).)

National Sentence Text: Where vehicular, watercraft or floatplane impact or physical damage is possible, protective guarding devices shall be provided for aboveground outdoor piping.
P/T Sentence Text: Where vehicular, watercraft or aircraft impact or physical damage is possible, protective guarding devices shall be provided for aboveground outdoor piping.

National Sentence Text: When piping referred to in Sentence 4.5.6.10. contains Class I liquids, the trench shall be provided with ventilation designed to prevent the accumulation of flammable vapours in accordance with Sentence 6.9.1.2. of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: When piping referred to in Sentence 4.5.6.10. contains Class I liquids, the trench shall be provided with ventilation designed to prevent the accumulation of flammable vapours in accordance with Sentence 6.9.1.2. of Division B of the NBC(AE).

National Sentence Text: To ensure proper operation, frequent inspections and tests shall be made of all safety shut-off valves and other fire safety devices, with particular attention directed to normally open, fusible-link-operated valves, float valves and automatic controls.
P/T Sentence Text: To ensure proper operation, monthly inspections and tests shall be made of all safety shut-off valves and other fire safety devices, with particular attention directed to normally open, fusible-link-operated valves, float valves and automatic controls.

National Sentence Text: Piping shall be firmly supported and protected by means of guarding devices where necessary to prevent vehicular, watercraft or floatplane impact damage, or other physical damage.
P/T Sentence Text: Piping shall be firmly supported and protected by means of guarding devices where necessary to prevent vehicular, watercraft or aircraft impact damage, or other physical damage.

National Sentence Text: Fixed dispensers for Class I liquids shall be installed outside buildings and not less than 3 m from any right-of-way and any property line, 3 m from any propane gas dispenser, 1.5 m from any natural gas dispenser, 6 m horizontally from any fixed source of ignition, 6 m horizontally from any liquefied petroleum gas cylinder or storage tank, and 3 m from any building openings, other than those that serve as shelter for operating personnel and in which electrical installations conform to Article 4.1.4.1.
P/T Sentence Text: ) Fixed dispensers for Class I liquids shall be installed outside buildings and not less than 3 m from any right-of-way and any property line, 3 m from any propane gas dispenser, 1.5 m from any natural gas dispenser, 6 m horizontally from any fixed source of ignition, 6 m horizontally from any liquefied petroleum gas cylinder or storage tank, 3 m from any building openings, other than those that serve as shelter for operating personnel and in which electrical installations conform to Article 4.1.4.1., and 6 m from any manhole or sewer opening (see Note A-4.6.3.3.(1)(g)).

National Sentence Text: The location of dispensers of Class I liquids within a building shall conform to Subsection 3.3.5. of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: The location of dispensers of Class I liquids within a building shall conform to Subsection 3.3.5. of Division B of the NBC(AE).

National Sentence Text: Dispensers at marine fuel-dispensing stations shall be in a location that will prevent watercraft or floatplane impact, or other physical damage.
P/T Sentence Text: Dispensers at marine fuel-dispensing stations shall be in a location that will prevent watercraft or aircraft impact, or other physical damage.

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.6.4.2. and in addition to the device required by Sentence 4.6.4.1.(1), an emergency shut-off switch to simultaneously stop the flow of fuel at all dispensers at self-service outlets shall be located at the central control console described in Sentence 4.6.8.2. so that it is readily accessible to the attendant.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.6.4.2.(2)and Sentences 4.6.8.2. to 4.6.8.2. and in addition to the device required by Sentence 4.6.4.1.(1), an emergency shut-off switch to simultaneously stop the flow of fuel at all dispensers at self-service outlets shall be located at the central control console described in Sentence 4.6.8.2. so that it is readily accessible to the attendant.

National Sentence Text: At card- or key-activated self-service outlets, the emergency shut-off switch required in Sentence 4.6.4.2. shall be readily accessible to the customer.
P/T Sentence Text: At card- or key-activated self-service outlets, the emergency shut-off switch required in Sentence 4.6.4.2. shall be in a readily accessible location acceptable to the authority having jurisdiction. (See Note A-4.6.4.2.(2).)

National Sentence Text: Every hose nozzle valve through which a Class I or II liquid is dispensed by a motorized dispenser into a vehicle tank shall be automatic closing as required in Sentence 4.6.5.2.(2), and conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S620-16 Hose Nozzle Valves for Flammable and Combustible Liquids
P/T Sentence Text: Every hose nozzle valve through which a Class I or II liquid is dispensed by a motorized dispenser into a vehicle tank shall be automatic closing as required in Sentence 4.6.5.2.(2), and conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S620-07 Hose Nozzle Valves for Flammable and Combustible Liquids

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.6.8.1.(2), every fuel-dispensing station shall have at least one attendant referred to in Article 4.6.8.5. on duty when the station is open for business.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.6.8.1.(2)and required by Sentences 4.6.8.2. to 4.6.8.2. for unattended self-service outlets, every fuel-dispensing station shall have at least one attendant referred to in Article 4.6.8.5. on duty when the station is open for business.

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted at self-service outlets, a qualified attendant shall be in constant control of the dispensing of Class I and II liquids into the fuel tanks of motor vehicles, watercraft or floatplanes, or into containers.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted at self-service outlets, a qualified attendant shall be in constant control of the dispensing of Class I and II liquids into the fuel tanks of motor vehicles, watercraft or aircraft, or into containers.

National Sentence Text: Operation of card- or key-activated dispensers shall be restricted to persons authorized by the supply agent to possess a card or key to operate the dispensers.

P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 4.6.8.6.(2), flammable liquids and combustible liquids shall not be dispensed into the fuel tank of a motor vehicle, watercraft or aircraft while the engine is running.

P/T Sentence Text: Where wiring or electrical equipment is located in areas in which flammable gases or vapours, combustible dusts or combustible fibres are present in quantities sufficient to create a hazard, such wiring and electrical equipment shall conform to CSA C22.1-18 Canadian Electrical Code, Part I for hazardous locations.
